title: Curriculum Vitae

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Summary
Computational biologist specializing in multi-omics, single-cell and spatial methods, exposure-driven toxicology, and disease modeling. Experienced in building end-to-end analytical pipelines integrating omics and exposure data to generate interpretable insights. Strong background in R and Python, with applied expertise in statistical and machine-learning methods for high-dimensional data, scalable HPC workflows, and reproducible translational bioinformatics.

Bulk omics: RNA-seq, DNA methylation, proteomics, metabolomics

Data quality control and exploratory data analysis

Statistical modeling and applied machine-learning methods

title: CV
text:
Research Interests
I am interested in leveraging high-throughput biological data to understand neurological disorders and chronic disease. Specifically, I am currently researching how sex and developmental stage affect multi-omics profiles of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). Additionally, I am creating new methods to characterize the relationship between exposure, health outcomes, and multi-omics signatures.

title: Jason Laird
text:
Department of Environmental Health and Engineering


Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health





I am a computational biologist and toxicologist with a passion for problem-solving.
I specialize in developing and applying computational methods to understand the complex interactions between exposures, molecular changes, and disease outcomes in neurology and immunology.
